description:
Formace is a chess-like game in which two armies fight to capture one of the two opponent's Overlords.

The playing board is a 12x12 checkered board which is divided into 3x3 quadrants. The quadrants are essential for game strategy.

The game is named after the formations which can be created by lined up Pawns. All Pawns in a "formation" can be moved together in one single turn.

Each player has 14 Pawns - the weakest units but able to create formations, 2 Executioners - opponents' units can not move if they are in the same quadrant, 2 Chieftains - leaders of formations and 2 Overlords - strong in movement but a game is lost when one of them is captured.

—user summary

Nusantara, 14th Century ..

Jawadwipa burned. Two unequal forces met on the battlefield. If before, Sunda thought that eventually it would end up with happiness, they must face the bitterness of seeing everything turn into disaster. King Linggabuana and Princess Dyah Pitaloka were astonished to see what was happening before their eyes. Majapahit besieged with complete weapons ready to melt Sunda. Gajah Mada wants Sunda to bow in Majapahit's lap. King Hayam Wuruk couldn't resist Sunda still hold fast the soul of the knights they have. Bela Pati is the only way they choose. They fought to protect their pride. They fought for the sake of their kingdom pride. They fought for the sake of the kstaria they have. They fought even though they knew it would all be ashes. They fought to the point of death.

After all there is nothing left, Princess Dyah Pitaloka chose to sacrifice herself in order to protect the pride of her kingdom. Even the King Hayam Wuruk was sad, his loved one is gone. But the spirit of struggle of the two kingdom countries teaches us, that what we dream of is worth fighting for until it becomes a reality.
Inspired by how the courage of the Sunda to fight against Majapahit, Bela Pati Boardgame was created. Aside from being a media for education of the dark history of the people of Indonesia, This board game will also take you to feel how the soul of  “ksatria”  in each step you choose burn in your heart. 
Choose the kingdom that you will play. Mighty Majapahit, or Brave Sunda. Find the path to victory to maintain the dignity and spirit of the knights of Nusantara.

The warrior pawns moves 4 directions while the king pawn moves 8 directions. There are change direction boxes and secret card boxes. If the pawn on the change direction box, then the pawn of the player has the right to change direction according to the available arrows. If it is in the secret card box, then the player has the right to take the card provided. victory can be achieved by spending all the opponent's pawns.

Laga Pendekar is a card game that invites all players to play & feel the simulation of Pencak Silat competition easily & fun. While playing, the players can get to know some of Pencak Silat techniques and style from the existing game components. This game aims to become a champion by reaching 15 points first. The unique part of this game is 5 characters with different abilities. Each character consists of 3 Style cards. This Style Card is used to attack to get points (without being able to strike back with a regular action card) or just defend (other options if there is no action card to counter other action cards).

However, if this style card is reversed, then it functions to be a Foul card. Used to counter actions, so that opponents can be deducted points.

—user summary

Welcome to the climbing area! As a novice climber, the climb begins from the easiest to the hardest climbing level, by passing several climbing posts and cannot easily achieve it, some obstacle that must be passed by climbers. By using a climbing information and PIN token it will be easier to reach the peak. Prabumeru is a board game with a theme nature especially mount on java island. Prabumeru is the name taken from mount prau, Mount Merbabu, and mount semeru. The game starts from basecamp Patak Banteng - Selo - Ranu Pane, players must pass each path until they pass the ascent post. Collect as many coins as possible and get a PIN token when in a special area to make it easier to climb. This game is very fun when players get obstacle and penalties. The game is finished  when the player is at the highest peak of mahameru. Feel the excitement on every trip!

War of the Words is one of word board game that emphasizing on finding most possible words while attacking other opponents and pursuing word bonuses. Purchase letters or special cards, play a word or the special card, sell your letters, and try to add bonus scores while learning words.

Each turn, player may purchase a letter or a card, playing a word with combo special cards effect, without throwing away letters after used. Your letters can be used to play as many as possible words and you may sell them to get new letters.

The moon beckons and the night is ripe! Perform the traditional black magic ritual of Santet to eliminate other shamans by rolling the dice, performing the forbidden ritual, enlisting the help from supernatural bloodthirsty demons, all to claim the glory to become the most feared black magic wielder from Nusantara!

The active player rolls 5 dice in Yahtzee fashion to accumulate certain desired symbols while balancing their shared Spell/Rage tracker that must not overlap; the spell is accumulated slowly to perform the ritual whilst bursts of Rage is needed to flip their double-sided Shaman card to the enraged form.

When a player lost their last Life token the game immediately ends and each player tally their accumulated points in form of Life tokens obtained from their enemies plus their remaining Life tokens' quantity.

Welcome to Mint City, welcome to the Apocalypse!

The inevitable apocalypse has arrived and you find yourself holed-up in Mint City.
As our intrepid hero you must leave the safety of the Secure Zone and brave the zombie-infested streets to find the components of a highly experimental and almost definitely feasible Z-Bomb.

You'll start out with nothing but your wits, and you'll need them as you dodge zombies and keep moving around the city to find your objectives.

Along the way you'll find Items and Ammo to help you in your quest and return safely to potentially perchance save Mint City.

—description from the designer

Everybody lies. This is especially true of your camouflage! (or not?) board game, where you have to choose from the statements you read, the Kam, ie the fake. Someone is always dumb, roles are constantly changing, where you have to guess and where to lie. Get your poker face up, build your inner lie detector, start the game! Uncover most liars and victory is yours! The statements on the cards are based on your knowledge, but the way the game is read is greatly influenced by the gameplay. Be alert, lie wisely, read between the lines!

Everyone used to lie sometimes, and this is also true for this game. Because of the statements you have to make, you have to decide what is true and what is not. Someone will always lie, and sometime you have to lie and then guess. Try to stay calm so your teammates won't notice when you're lying and when you're not. Be smart and be careful you never know and when you lie !!

Happy Nation is a game where players try to become the happiest player by deciding each turn on how to spend their time and money. In this game, happiness is the collection of all your joyful experiences.

Each of the 5 characters produces unique items, which the other players can buy to achieve their goals. In addition to time and money management for actions, the setting of prices and convincing other players to buy your items or to work more is an important element.

Players identify quickly with the real-life theme and one of the 5 characters: Builder, Farmer, Entertainer, Banker or Doctor.

The game brings all elements for a 1-2 hour playing experience, with the right mix of strategy, luck and interaction.

As a bonus you might learn how bank loans function in our societies.

—description from the designer

Outwit your friends with pharmacy finesse, daring diet and exercise, noble nutrition and lifestyle choices while avoiding terrible temptations given to you by your friends.  Strategize how to get the best blood sugar score and earn the admiration of your family, friends, and general practitioner.  Pit yourself against other diabetic warriors in the ultimate battle of diabetes management, Battlebetes.
—description from the publisher

Battlebetes is a card drafting and scoring game played in three rounds where each round each player is trying to be the closest to 100.  Each round has two parts: “Drafting Cards” and “Throwing and Scoring”.  The player with the highest score after three rounds wins. The first part is a "draft and pass" dynamic like "sushi go" and "7 wonders".  This leaves players with five important choices that will ultimately decide their chances of winning.  Do you: stack one card or balance cards, directly attack others or choose a card just to prevent another from getting it, save it for later or spend now? In the scoring phase each player throws their resulting food tokens like dice (each side has a number) adding any modifiers obtained resulting in their round score.

This game could not be any easier to play.  Throw the dice and the "famous person" will give you a clue to their identity based on the number of the dice - throw a six and will even get the name you are looking for!

—description from the publisher

The Pet Matching Game for Kids of All Ages!

54 character adoptable animal pet cards for 100’s of combinations
Great family game for ages 7+.
Easier game rules for kids under age 7!
Match the characters by type and personality.
Easy, fun to read character descriptions.
Easy to follow match-up icons.
Keep track of points from multiple rounds for hours of fun!

The object of Com-Pet-Ability is to find five animal characters who are Com-Pet-Able so you can take them home and win the hand! Each Animal Character has its own personality and traits that make them more, or less, Com-Pet-Able with other Animal Characters.

A player needs to get five completely Com-Pet-Able Animal Characters in their hand to make the adoption and end the round! Play multiple rounds to keep the game going, adding more points as you go!

A free two-player card game which uses a standard deck of cards.

Duel 52 is a game of board control and tempo. The board is divided into three opposing lanes, where both players fight for control.

Players take turns drawing cards, playing cards into lanes, using powers and attacking the opponents board.

The game ends when a player wins two lanes. A lane is won by killing all opposing cards in that lane.

—description from the designer

Add a little fun to your training!
Behind Closed Doors is a card game designed to accompany the training of the commonly named Residence Life Resident Assistant student position. These cards reflect experiences from a multitude of schools and departments and is fun and interesting for new and veteran staff alike because it frames conversations and fosters the sharing of experiences for the supervisor to cover.

Staff draw cards and pick one scenario out of the hand to tackle, taking into account the difficulty of the situation which awards different point values. Staffs take turns attempting to resolve the situation to a supervisor or senior staff's satisfaction to earn points and avoid biting off more than they can choose and lose the points indicated. Rare game cards allow for lifelines, passing on difficult scenarios, and other helpful powers.

Behind Closed Doors is a training card game for employees of university residence life. Introduce your students to novel real-life situations, build team-work, and foster a supportive environment.

—description from the designer

The 9th core game for the ELL game system.

Make small fragments of the alphabet on one of 4 rows.

Each turn, draw a card, pick up a card from the end of a row, then place 2 cards. Placed cards and the card before them must form a 3-letter 'fragment' (3 consecutive letters, in order).

As each card can be used for 2 different letters, there is a skill in deciding what fragments to build.

At the end, you will have hopefully managed your cards so as to have some 'runs' of letters that you can place down to win the game!

—description from the publisher

This super BrainBox board game now takes every player to the past to experience the age of the dinosaurs or the defining moments of ancient Egyptian civilization. The social goal is for players to memorize as much information as possible within 10 seconds about the tales on the drawn card. After the time has elapsed, you must correctly answer the number rolled dice. The answers can be checked on the card.

This game wants to put a focus on the rights children (should) have.
On a 7 by 7 grid square tiles similar to Labyrinth show paths and dead ends. On your turn, roll a colored die that allows you to flip, rotate or switch one or more tiles. (The color „red“ on the die allows  to go directly to an adjacent tile ignoring the path system.) Then move your pawn along the paths to reach a destination. Each player has one secret destination card and tries to accomplish it. After you reached your destination, try to accomplish the task or answer the question. The other players may help you. If you succeed, read the written text (articles of the convention of children’s rights) on the back of the tile aloud and keep the card. When all destinations are reached, the player with the most accomplished cards wins.

Developed by Matthias Gradinger
Produced by Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion-Service GmbH.

To lie or not to lie...but the power must be yours!

Republia is a role playing game about politics, where you have to create your own discourse based on words highlighted in law cards and try to pass them to achieve your ideology's objective.

You'll play as a Libertarian, a Monarchist, as the Neo Liberal, Fascist, Communist, Totalitarian, Anarchist or Socialist. Organize Coups, Rallies and much more in this 3 to 8 player game.

To win, you must move the Population Token to your ideology's Point on the board, or gather Corruption points and Political Power to achieve its Objective.

—description from the designer

To start the game, each player draws five white cards.

The player who has most recently logged into an EHR goes first. The player flips over a green card and reads the question or phrase aloud.

This is a war simulation game talked about Battle for Caen in 1944 for 1 - 2 players. The biggest feature in this game is no random elements (no dice, no CRT...).

Components:
Map x 1
Counters x 82
Cards x 55
Rule-book x 1

Children aged 4+ can learn about opposites with this beautifully illustrated BrainBox. Designed for parents to play with their children, this great game will improve observation and memory skills. Whether players are old or young, big or small, BrainBox Opposites will provide fun for all the family.

2400 questions the yummiest trivia game ever!

Whether you are a fast food junkie, a lover of good home cooking or an expert in haute cuisine,  Food and drink trivia has something for you.

—description from the publisher

Whose letter card will the bottle point to when it stops spinning?  Who will the be victim that has to be kissed on the part of  the body beginning with that letter ? Is it going to be the player with N (nose) or the player with T (toe)
This hilarious game for bold players will have you frantically thinking up names for body parts (B for ... Bellybutton) and stealing kisses to win you the game.  But if the victim forbids you to kiss that body part you can use the ink stamp to decorate that very nose toe or belly button that was refused a kiss. The victim has one last option, to perform one of the forfeits on the back of one of the letter card. But it could be an embarrassing one.

Enter a whole new battleground in this new Dragon Ball Z adventure!

An epic game of fun and strategy!
Defeat the wizard Babidi's forces and stop the evil Majin Buu! Travel the game board of the real and other worlds to prove that you are the strongest saiyan warrior in the universe. Carry out board actions, gain ki energy, and acquire wishes in order to collect items that will help you in your fight against evil. Be the first saiyan to complete your score card by returning all 4 unique support items to your Kami's palace and be crowned the strongest!
—description from the publisher

2 to 4 players will compete to collect a set of tokens (Called support items) by rolling dices and moving around a board. The first player to bring back the different support items to his/her base win. A combination of lucky rolls and good usage of your action cards will help you reach this goal.
—user summary

Dice Throne Season One ReRolled is a remastered edition of Dice Throne: Season One with two new characters! Fully redesigned with folding boards, individual character storage trays, Battle Chest storage, and two new heroes: Treant and Ninja!

Dice Throne is a game of intriguing dice, tactical card play, powerful heroes, and unique abilities.

It's a fast-paced 2-6 player combat game (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all). Select from a variety of heroes that play and feel completely distinct from one another. Attack opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

—description from the publisher

A game of fishing and hunting in the Arctic.
Roll the custom die and move one of your eskimos, an ice floe, and/or the polar bear. The object of the game is to get all one's eskimos from the starting area to the other end of the board and back again.

—user summary

The object is to win (obviously) and you do that by beating your opponent (or 5 other opponents, because the game is designed for up to 6 players)...
Each player has there own colour coded jigsaw.  There are 25 pieces to be pieced together each question answered correctly is rewarded by a piece of the puzzle SIMPLE??... NO. because not all of the pieces fit.. and not only that, but the questions are designed for someone of a high intellectual standard, so ... if your ready here's a little taste of whats in score....

—description from the back of the box

Semi-cooperative card game in which up to four players put themselves in the shoes of some students who, attacked in the forest by a group of strange creatures, manage to lock themselves in a shabby wooden house. Help is on its way, but the creatures are increasingly more and the walls will not resist much more.

One of the players will take the role of the group of creatures that, as if it were a hive mind, will make strategic decisions to try to open a gap through which to access the interior of the cabin and ending their prey. If he succeeds, they will have gained the forces of darkness. If the students resist the number of shifts necessary for rescuers to arrive, everything will have been in a tremendous fright, and the young people will have won.
Semi-cooperative card game in which up to four players put themselves in the shoes of some students who, attacked in the forest by a group of strange creatures, manage to lock themselves in a shabby wooden house. Help is on its way, but the creatures are increasingly more and the walls will not resist much more.

One of the players will take the role of the group of creatures that, as if it were a hive mind, will make strategic decisions to try to open a gap through which to access the interior of the cabin and ending their prey. If he succeeds, they will have gained the forces of darkness. If the students resist the number of shifts necessary for rescuers to arrive, everything will have been in a tremendous fright, and the young people will have won.
—description from the designer
 Juego de cartas semi-cooperativo en el que hasta cuatro jugadores se ponen en la piel de unos estudiantes que, atacados en el bosque por un grupo de extrañas criaturas, consiguen encerrarse en una destartalada casa de madera. La ayuda viene en camino, pero las criaturas cada vez son más  y las paredes no resistirán mucho más.

Un jugador tomará el papel del grupo de criaturas que, como si de una mente-colmena se tratase, tomarán decisiones estratégicas para intentar abrir una brecha por la que acceder al interior de la cabaña y dar buena cuenta de sus presas. Si lo consigue, habrán ganado las fuerzas de la oscuridad. Si los estudiantes resisten el número de turnos necesario para que lleguen los rescatadores, todo habrá quedado en un tremendo susto, y los jóvenes habrán vencido.
—description from the designer (Spanish)

Car Wars is a game featuring arenas and freeways of the future in which the right of way goes to those with the biggest guns. 
Players build their vehicle — complete with weapons, armor, suspension, and upgrades. Then they take them onto the road or into the arena. Sixth Edition is a streamlined update of the classic Car Wars.  Quicker to build your car, quicker to learn to play, quicker to jump right in.

Players race across the Islands to be the first to reach a wreck site located at each of the four corners of the game board. The first player to reach a wreck selects a 'buddy' from among the other plays and they then dive to the Treasure Site of their choice and attempt to recover the doubloons buried there.

BUT... The divers' time underwater is limited and meanwhile the other players have suspended their activity on the Islands and have become SHARKS. The sharks close in on the divers, intent on defending sites where they have hidden their own doubloons. They are also determined to steal any doubloons the divers may have recovered.

The winner is the first player to reach the airport with 12 doubloons in his possession.

—user summary

Enemy Weapon is a card-based party game for 3+ players, where you and your fellow players will be engaging in a series of epic battles, facing off against a variety of powerful enemies.

To aid in your fight, you'll have access to an assortment of legendary weapons. Each round you must examine your arsenal closely, and choose the artifact or special power most capable of vanquishing the current foe.

With weapon in hand, each player must weave their own tale of glorious battle, arguing that they alone possess the tool necessary to defeat the enemy. However, only the warrior who presents the most unique (and hilarious) plan of attack will earn the favor of the almighty judge, and claim victory.

Warrior, the time has come for you to abandon the tired distractions of lesser men. Steel your resolve, summon your courage, and prepare your butthole for the glory of Enemy Weapon.

—description from the designer

The game is based on a simple mechanism: the player rolls the dice and moves on the board for the number of rolls rolled, and then performs the action that was described in the field where he stopped (pulling the card, receiving a penalty or prize, lottery draw or rest) . Before making a move, each player must pay a mandatory fee (10 "pnÅ¼"), symbolizing daily living expenses. Before rolling the dice, you can take out a loan, buy a good or a lottery ticket, and send your resume.

The game begins as an unemployed with an allowance and three CVs, but each character has a variety of abilities, in addition, after the first day of each month, the right to sell their goods is acquired, and for each profession there are two levels of promotion.

The goal of the game is "survival" - getting a job, own home and living. The winner is the player who not only owns a job and own house, but is also not in debt and his home is not occupied by a tenant. In the event that more than one player meets these conditions, the victory is determined by better paid work, goods and money.

The instructions, like the content of the cards and fields on the board, are described in a humorous, or even satirical way. The authors of the game are detached from the decisions of state officials and various life situations.

Mantis Falls is a "sometimes cooperative" game of hidden roles, strategy and deduction for 2-3 players.

As witness to something not meant to be seen, you must escape the dark mob-ruled town of Mantis Falls alive. You are told another witness will join you, and together you must use cooperation to survive the increasingly dangerous roads of the night. Your ability to work with another could be your greatest strength, but what if they are not who they claim to be?

By the deal of hidden roles, each game could have only witnesses, meaning you must all survive together to win. Or there could secretly be an assassin hidden among you, subtly manipulating the situation and waiting for the right moment to strike.

Inspired by shadowy film noir worlds, Mantis Falls is a thematic journey that requires players to continually weigh the value of cooperation against the implicit perils of trust. Hand management and facedown card play combine with opportunities for betrayal to create a detailed blend of strategy, player interaction and suspicion. At every turn, players make concealed moves and develop hidden plans, but will also have thorough conversations as they discuss tactics, defend choices and bluff to protect carefully guarded secrets.

Mantis Falls is sometimes a game of competition balanced with indecision and sacrifice, and sometimes it is a game of cooperation challenged by doubts and distrust. With care, you may figure out which one you are playing before it's too late.

The Face It Challenge game is based on the "Face It Challenge" game that takes place on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.

Each round in the game, two players each get a description of a crazy face that they must make, then show each other. The game includes a double-sided mirror so that each player can prep their face ahead of time, then at a push of the button, the mirror drops, and players start staring at one another. Freeze your face while trying to make your opponent laugh or otherwise crack their composure. Whoever holds their face longest wins the round.

In Ecologies, you build and maintain food webs in diverse biomes around the world. Each biome has a different ecology, and gives unique rewards when it is healthy and balanced. But watch out, your opponents may decide it's easier to disturb and degrade your ecosystems than nurture their own. In this hectic environment, you must choose how best to protect and care for your ecologies.

Designed by a biology instructor, the game includes 77 unique organisms, 7 biomes, and beautiful vintage Victorian art. (108 cards total)

It’s all about building healthy food webs in different biomes. If you create a healthy ecology you get the perks and powers of that biome. Each organism card lists what it eats and what it’s eaten by. You arrange them with plants on the bottom, predators on top. There is a trade mechanic similar to catan where you trade with others based on what you need and what they need. It is a race to get 12 victory points and different organisms give different points. There are factor cards that can affect opponents and different strategies such as focusing on one biome, going for perks and bonuses, or attacking other ecologies.

The game takes inspiration from titles like Settlers of Catan, Agricola, and Dominion. Real science is integral to the game as it is used in the classroom to teach real concepts to biology students. While it is scientific enough for the classroom it is also strategic enough for game night.

The points system is based on ecological trophic levels. The producers (plants) are worth less and as you make your way up the pyramid organisms are worth more as it takes a lot of energy to sustain them. In real life only roughly 10% of the energy makes it from one level to the next, meaning you have to have acres of land and hundreds of animals just to sustain one apex predator. There is a full rule book included with the card game that also goes over the science.

—description from the publisher

18TE is an 18xx game in the german region of 'Tecklenburger Land'.

The focus of the game ist to give gamers without 18xx experience a possibility to play an 18xx with easy rules in a short time.

Take it as your first step into 18xx gaming. Experienced players may use it as a nightcap.

No privates, only 5 companies, a small map and 30% president shares make it playable for 2 or 3 players shortly.

—description from the designer

A very simple roll die and move game, but by playing it one might be led to learn a little about Cubism. An example of instructions on a space is "You’re jealous of Braque; GO BACK
3". Notes are included; the note relating to the above instructions is "Even though Picasso may be considered the most famous Cubist painter, it is known that he was often jealous of Braque’s innovations and ideas". The board is done in a Cubist style. It is one of several games about art available from the Artsology website.

The ultimate board game for any gin lover!

It's a game of chance and twists that will test your gin knowledge. Work your way around the board by answering History cards, Mixology cards, Gin-ius cards.

Cosmic: The Iliad is a strategic dexterity game which will launch you into the depths of space, to conquest for galactic domination. Only the best use of strategy and skill will push you to victory. Yet victory may become obsolete, when confronted with the creatures that lurk in the abyss.

The game has a campaign mode and a skirmish mode.Players build fleets of ships and eliminate enemy ships. The campaign mode consists of 3-5 individual battles, between which players can upgrade their ships, purchase captains and ships, or purchase space for a larger fleet. Each battle is in a different environment, some filled with asteroids, others with beasts roaming around the map.

—description from the designer

XenoCommand is an elite international organization tasked with countering alien invasions of Earth.

Each player starts with a modular base and several structures. Roll the dice to gain resources that correspond to your structures. Spend gold and tech to expand your base, upgrade your defenses, recruit agents and buy vehicles. But as each time you roll the dice, the invader's plans advance, bringing you closer to the inevitable invasion.

When the UFOs descend on Earth, the invaders will breech your base! The only way to survive is to spend wisely, position strategically, and cooperate with your fellow defenders. Wipe out the invaders or capture them to steal their secrets to create advanced weaponry! Survive the onslaught of invader attacks and team up to send your forces into space for a climactic battle against the invader Mothership!

"Jeff Davis: The Confederacy at War" is a Strategic level solitaire board wargame designed by Charles S. Roberts Award-winner R. Ben Madison and published by White Dog Games. You play President Jefferson Davis, managing the Confederate government and the Southern war effort. Your choices help determine the fate of great armies and the titanic struggle between Lee and Grant as well as peripheral or more dispersed campaigns like Morgan’s Ohio raid and Indian Territory.

Decide which famous generals are worthy of scarce artillery and ironclads resources, while you unleash bushwhackers behind Union lines and rush reinforcements into battle on your rickety rail network. Back in Richmond, you’ll push the Confederate Congress to enact your reforms and overcome the inefficiency of States’ Rights as you defend key cities vital to your political survival. Dispatch your cabinet members as economic troubleshooters to prop up agriculture, industry and infrastructure for the war effort.

Slavery is a major factor in your economy, but you will pay for most of your actions through the cat-and-mouse game of blockade running. Choose which armies to supply, or to invade the North as you calculate where the next Union hammer might fall.

Can you hold out long enough, or trigger British and French intervention? Re-fight the Civil War as Jeff Davis!

—description from the publisher

GAME SYSTEM

    
    
         This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.

    



 The Evangelion Card Game is the third series expansion for the Chrono Clash System. Years ago, the Earth was attacked by unnatural creatures called Angels. To defend the people against the next Angel attacks, the world's governments and Nerv built the Evas, giant mechs of unknown power.

Currently featuring Naruto/Boruto and Godzilla, the Chrono Clash System is a fast paced, living card game in which players alternate back and forth making big attacks and summoning even larger creatures. The bigger the attack or creature a player plays during their turn, the more resources they give their opponent for their next turn.

Who will rule the canals?

Welcome to Brugge, the Venice of the North! Canal building business is booming and everyone wants their share of the proï¬ts. Use canal tiles to build a route connecting your starting port to your ï¬nal destination via two ports of call. Once the route is ready, hop on your ship and sail to the ï¬nish line as fast as you can. Be on your guard though, because your devious competitors will try to slow you down!

Who will reach the ï¬nish line ï¬rst and conquer the canals?

—description from the publisher

Prepare your adventurers for a challenging dungeon exploration in Paper Dungeons, a roll-and-write game that seeks to reproduce the feel of a dungeon-crawler.

In the game, you control a classic group of medieval adventurers: warrior, wizard, cleric, and rogue. In each of the nine rounds, you select three of the six rolled dice and use these results to raise the level of your characters, produce magic items, obtain healing potions, and explore the dungeon to face challenges and collect treasure. You'll also find three large monsters waiting in the dungeon, and you can fight them for glory.

In the end, whoever collects the most glory wins.

MechaTop is a board game system that will allow you to deploy on the battlefield all the models of your favorite mecha that you already have at home!

The innovative game mechanics "cockpit control system" will make you live a frantic battle experience like the ones we are used to see on TV.

The rules will contain a special section, where the player will be guided, step by step, in the creation of the stat-card of any robot model.

The algorithm that determines the cost in points of the various units and weapons has been refined in over 2 years of playtest and guarantees a perfect balance.

If you're a fan of robot TV series from the 70s to the present day, you won't want to miss it!

Fresco: The Card Game takes the core game play of Fresco and distills it into a smaller, faster playing design.

The Bishop has specific wishes when it comes to the new fresco that should brighten up the cathedral. He has very particular instructions about what should be painted in specific places. Players will take on the role of painters attempting to paint the new fresco according to his instruction, receiving points in the game for painting the Fresco and bonus points for fulfilling the Bishops' requests.

During the game players draw color cards which they will use to paint sections of the fresco. Color cards can be gained from the market, which holds the three basic colors, or from the workshop, which contains the mixed color palette. When players have enough colors they can paint a section of the fresco and gain points. Play the right combination of cards, and you will extra points.

When all sections of the fresco are painted, players total up their points and who has the most points is the winner of the game.

Fresco - The Dice Game

Roll and combine the right combination of dice to gain fresco tiles and be the first to complete your fresco!

The goal of the game is to complete the five different tiles to form a complete fresco. In order to complete a fresco tile players have to roll a result that matches the number next to each fresco tile.

On their turn, players roll the dice exactly three times, on each roll setting one die aside. After the three rolls, the pips on the three set aside dice are added together, which allows the player to collect the corresponding tile. If the result does not match a fresco tile number, they gain a portrait token which will grant bonuses or points. The two color dice can be used to double the number on the corresponding colored die, making it easier to reach the higher numbers.

Before a turn players can place the bishop on one of the five fresco tile spaces, earning extra points if they manage to roll that exact number. Other players can bet on whether the player is successful or not, and will earn some extra points if they guess correctly. At the end of the game, players count the points on their fresco and portrait tiles, and whomever has the most points is the winner of the game.

Death Battle!: The Game is a fast-paced head-to-head card and dice game where players duel to the bitter end... To defeat your foe, you must outsmart and outwit their own devious battle plans. Are you deadly enough to win a Death Battle?

In Death Battle!, gameplay continues until there is one player left standing. Each player is given a number of Armor, Weapon, and Skill cards to assemble a combo of card and dice abilities to combat their opponent's battle plan or punch right through it.

—description from the publisher

At ancient forgotten ritual places, you want to call the Old Gods to gain as much secret influence over the world as possible.
To do this you first have to discover the places and then gather together four cultists.
The more skilled the cultists are who call the gods for you, the more your power grows.
But you have to fight against many bad events.
Not every cultist is equally well skilled to any ritual, and the order in which the cultists appear at the ritual place is of great importance.

Each player has 7 hand cards.
The game play is draw one card and play one card at each turn.
The hand cards are cultists and event cards.
All player play their card face down and reweal them at the same time.
The cards of the cultists shows three possible ritual places where the cultist can be placed. The insanity worth of the cultist shows when the card can played and the elder signs shows the victory points you can get depending on the side of a ritual place where the card is placed. If four cultists at a ritual place, an invocation is performed and the owner of the ritual place get victory points for three cultist and one other player for one. The ritual place is lost after an invocation.
If a event card is played the card explains what will happen.
The player tries to place cultist with a high worth at there own ritual places and the lower at the places of other players. A player can be forced to place high victory points to a place of another player because of the placement rules and the play of other players or of event cards.
Each player start with one ritual places and there are special rules how to get more or a new one.
When the draw deck is empty, the game ends and the player with the most victory points wins.

Monkeys vs Lemurs is an extremely addictive, fast-paced card game that you can enjoy with up to 8 people! Choose which side you want to fight for, the monkey's side or the lemur's side, and battle it out with your friends for survival on the magical island of Leme! Win the game by forming teams, conquering territories and beating your opponents one by one! The game is very intense so watch out! While playing the game you will be able to admire each cards unique artwork, laugh at all the funny lemur quotes, and overall you will have a blast playing it! Guaranteed!

—description from the publisher
